byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from Des Moines, and Richard Pérez-Peña and Jonah Engel Bromwich from New York. Reporting was contributed by Ann Hinga Klein from Urbandale, Iowa, and Des Moines, Sewell Chan from London, Erin McCann and Susan Beachy from New York, and David Philipps from Colorado Springs.
byline.original: By MITCH SMITH, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and JONAH ENGEL BROMWICH

abstract: Scott M Greene peacefully surrenders to Des Moines area authorities after fatally shooting Police Officers Anthony Beminio and Justin Martin in their patrol cars; local residents and officials express surprise at scale of Greene's violence despite being aware of his extensive history of criminal activity and personal troubles; shootings are latest in number of killings of law enforcement officers, trend that has intensified election-year debates about relations between communities and police.
lead_paragraph: The officers were shot early Wednesday in Des Moines and in Urbandale. A suspect, described as a troubled loner familiar to the police, soon surrendered.
snippet: The officers were shot early Wednesday in Des Moines and in Urbandale. A suspect, described as a troubled loner familiar to the police, soon surrendered....

headline.main: Iowa Police Arrest Suspect in ‘Ambush’ Killings of 2 Officers
headline.print_headline: Iowa Man Surrenders After Two Police Officers Are Ambushed Overnight
